thread.section_title: Jose Mourinho claims only one West Brom player was on international duty before Manchester United clash – Metro
thread.title: Jose Mourinho claims only one West Brom player was on international duty before Manchester United clash
thread.title_full: Jose Mourinho claims only one West Brom player was on international duty before Manchester United clash

author: Chris Davie
title: Jose Mourinho claims only one West Brom player was on international duty before Manchester United clash
text:
Jose Mourinho claims West Brom have had only one player on international duty. (AFP/Getty Images) Jose Mourinho has incorrectly claimed that Manchester United are at a disadvantage against West Brom because only one of their players has been on international duty.
United host the Baggies at Old Trafford on Saturday as they look to continue their bid to secure a top-four place.
Mourinho has suggested that West Brom have an edge ahead of the fixture because Tony Pulis has had time to work with most of his squad during the international break.
But West Brom have had seven first-team players in action during the last two weeks.
Jake Livermore made his England debut, while Salomon Rondon travelled to South America to play two full games for Venezuela in their World Cup qualifiers.
Darren Fletcher and James Morrison featured for Scotland, Chris Brunt, Gareth McAuley and Jonny Evans all got a run-out for Northern Ireland, Hal Robson-Kanu started in both of Wales’ games, while Nacer Chadli played 167 minutes for Belgium.
Mourinho says West Brom have had time to ‘rest and prepare’. (Getty Images) More: Football Alexis Sanchez gives Chelsea major hope with latest interview on Arsenal future 
Jose Mourinho speaks out over Man United's interest for 'absurd' £173m superstar 
Antonio Conte in disagreement with Chelsea's board over £70m transfer 
‘I watched Antonio Valencia’s match in Ecuador, Marcos Rojo in Bolivia, but they don’t arrive until Thursday afternoon,’ Mourinho told Sky Sports.
‘If you compare our situation with our opponents – West Bromwich Albion only had one player on international duty.
‘They had time to work, time to rest and prepare. It is going to be hard.’
MORE: Arsenal ace Alexis Sanchez set for fitness test ahead of Manchester City clash 
MORE: Chelsea target Alexis Sanchez insists he wants to stay in London if he leaves Arsenal
